alert.note: Alert for Grand; San Juan (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 5:06PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Utah and southeast Utah, including the following counties, Southern Grand and Northern San Juan. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rainfall rates due to thunderstorms. This will cause additional flooding along the lower Kane Creek drainage where heavy rainfall fell yesterday. Between 0.3 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hunters Canyon, Kane Springs Canyon - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lower portions of Kane Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
